intro: Raddia calypsoides, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Raddia calypsoides is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its role in supporting local pollinators.
